ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would summarize the course as being a crash course in the history of theory from Pythagoras to Zarlino with an enormous reading list and stimulating class discussion. I would certainly recommend this course to another student, especially if it were going to be taught by David Cohen again, who kept the level of discussion high at every class meeting.
Great. Take it - you'll learn a lot and it will definitely help you prepare for your exams.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Though the course is probably not directly relevant to my own research interests, I learned a great deal about the field and I feel more prepared for my qualifying exams. I could not be more glad about having had the opportunity to learn the things I did in a seminar environment as stimulating as Music 721 was.
